div.a: Sony Announces The PlayStation 4, But Doesn't Reveal The Console

div.div: On stage at the "See the Future" event in New York, Sony has just announced its latest gaming console: the PlayStation 4.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y9urTN&via=Digg&text=Sony Announces The PlayStation 4, But Doesn't Reveal The Console

div.a: This Is What Happens When You Ask The Internet To Name A Planet

div.div: Star Trek fans have something to rejoice in: "Vulcan" is the leading contender in a vote to name two of Pluto's recently discovered moons.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YB0n1s&via=Digg&text=This Is What Happens When You Ask The Internet To Name A Planet

div.a: The Untold Story Of The Oscars' Nightmare Opening

div.div: Once upon a time -- March 29, 1989, to be exact -- a 22-year-old aspiring actress named Eileen Bowman thought that all her dreams were about to come true. She was very wrong.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YAw4Yx&via=Digg&text=The Untold Story Of The Oscars' Nightmare Opening

div.a: The Mao Mango Cult Of 1968 And The Rise Of China’s Working Class

div.div: For 2,000 years, the peach was the iconic fruit of China. But for a brief time, the mango was China’s most revered produce item, whose meaning was unwittingly bestowed upon it by none other than Mao Zedong.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12ZGdnu&via=Digg&text=The Mao Mango Cult Of 1968 And The Rise Of China’s Working Class

div.a: Just Some Pictures Of Marines Drinking Cobra Blood

div.div: During a joint military exercise, Thai soldiers showed U.S. Marines how to catch a cobra with their bare hands and drink its blood to survive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XMSqnK&via=Digg&text=Just Some Pictures Of Marines Drinking Cobra Blood

div.a: What Your Startup Culture Really Says

div.div: "Culture is not about the furniture in your office. It is not about how much time you have to spend on feel-good projects. It is not about catered food, expensive social outings, internal chat tools, your ability to travel all over the world, or your never-ending self-congratulation... Culture is ugly."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y9bUXE&via=Digg&text=What Your Startup Culture Really Says

div.a: How Was The Top-Secret Coke Formula Determined To Be Kosher?

div.div: The 126-year-old Coca-Cola recipe is one of the most closely guarded secrets in culinary history. So how did the company prove the formula met strict rabbinical guidelines while still keeping its prized formula a secret?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13fCEFj&via=Digg&text=How Was The Top-Secret Coke Formula Determined To Be Kosher?

div.div: WILL ONLY APPEAR ON OPRAH'S COUCH COURT

div.a: Lance Armstrong Will Only Come Clean Again To His Own International Tribunal

div.div: Passing up his final opportunity to cooperate with the investigation from his eternal enemies at the U.S. Anti-Doping Agency, Lance Armstrong on Wednesday unveiled bigger plans for his official, non-Oprah coming-clean party: He'll only talk to a global court that doesn't exist yet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/135dHAP&via=Digg&text=Lance Armstrong Will Only Come Clean Again To His Own International Tribunal

div.div: YOUR FAMILY WILL STILL HATE YOU THOUGH

div.a: Methopoly Lets You Play Breaking Bad At Home Without Ruining Your Entire Life

div.div: Given that most attempts to "play Breaking Bad at home" generally end in explosions, Joanne Silverman has performed a genuine community service by turning the AMC drama into a board game.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xjg5QH&via=Digg&text=Methopoly Lets You Play Breaking Bad At Home Without Ruining Your Entire Life

div.a: Winery Experiments With Aging Wines In The Ocean

div.div: An experiment in the age-old art of winemaking began on Wednesday as a California winery submerged four cases of Cabernet Sauvignon in Charleston Harbor to see how the ocean affects the aging of the wine.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YByHJH&via=Digg&text=Winery Experiments With Aging Wines In The Ocean

div.a: Iranian Ayatollahs Issue Fatwa Against 3G

div.div: Iranian mobile operator Rightel is providing the country's mobile users with their first 3G Internet services, but the company's video-calling feature has drawn the ire of the country's clerical establishment.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vwk6QZ&via=Digg&text=Iranian Ayatollahs Issue Fatwa Against 3G

div.div: YOU COULD NEVER USE YOUR MILES ANYWAY

div.a: How The American Airlines Merger Affects Frequent Flyers

div.div: The American Airlines and US Airways merger is a game changer for the airline industry. Reducing the number of airlines means less competition and eventually increased airfare. Not only will this merger affect the consumer’s wallet but also their frequent flyer miles. So what happens to the loyal frequent flyers of each program?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y8Rn5J&via=Digg&text=How The American Airlines Merger Affects Frequent Flyers

div.a: The Bar Mitzvah Invitation No One Can Refuse

div.div: The world’s best bar mitzvah invitation starring the least enthusiastic rapper.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XNhPOb&via=Digg&text=The Bar Mitzvah Invitation No One Can Refuse

div.a: Why No One Cares About Your New Homepage

div.div: Like other titans of another tech age, Yahoo is facing an existential threat against which it may be defenseless: People just don’t surf the web the way they used to.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y7XKWS&via=Digg&text=Why No One Cares About Your New Homepage

div.a: How Fashion Week Gets Photographed

div.div: This is life in the photographers’ pit, the shadowy area at the end of the runway from which all Fashion Week runway images emerge worldwide.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11VwoaU&via=Digg&text=How Fashion Week Gets Photographed

div.div: ADMIT IT, YOU WANT TO TRY THEM

div.a: Things You Can Officially Do With Google Glass

div.div: Until today, Google hadn't said much about its (possibly creepy) artificial intelligence glasses or what they will actually, you know, do. But the release of a new (definitely extreme) promotional video for Google Glass starts to give us an idea.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y7Sy5f&via=Digg&text=Things You Can Officially Do With Google Glass

div.a: Armstrong Won Over $218 Million While Cheating

div.div: Lance Armstrong is the richest cheater to be stripped of a championship or Olympic medal for using performance-enhancing drugs. It isn’t even close.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xpxe8c&via=Digg&text=Armstrong Won Over $218 Million While Cheating

div.a: Dolphins May Call Each Other By Name

div.div: What might dolphins be saying with all those clicks and squeaks? Each others’ names, suggests a new study of the so-called signature whistles that dolphins use to identify themselves.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y8QOZx&via=Digg&text=Dolphins May Call Each Other By Name

div.div: STAND CLEAR OF THE CLOSING DOORS

div.a: Two Centaur Bros Turn To Craigslist For Wedding Dates

div.div: Hey ladies, see those two hulking patriotic centaurs down there? You’re in luck, because those two strapping lads are questing through the Craigslist wasteland for a little female companionship to attend their cousin’s wedding this March.

div.a: 'The Hobbit' And Pounds Of Yak Hair

div.div: The dwarfs who accompany Bilbo Baggins in “The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey” may be small, but their hair and beards live large.

div.a: North Korea's First Racing Video Game Is Terrible

div.div: North Korea has been in the news lately for a very scary reason, but it isn’t every day that Asia’s hermit kingdom releases a car-racing video game. And when they do, you can definitely expect it to be a boring simulation about driving down a pin-straight, barely decorated highway.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XMWWmm&via=Digg&text=North Korea's First Racing Video Game Is Terrible
